name: places/ChIJe_ZBfBNZwokReDElxAA7XBs
formattedAddress: 39 W 38th St #11, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 39 W 38th St #11, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: Hello.  This is a great way to get your foot in the door of the modeling industry.  Besides creating a portfolio, they also provide you a website and advice / information on your modeling career.  They take great professional pictures, and provide sound advice, all the way to your first agency contract.  I signed with an agency within 6 months, under their guidance.  Keep in mind, this is not a modeling agency.

originalText.text: WARNING. do NOT go to this studio. They waste your time and day to scam you into signing a 4,000.00 contract without explaining properly. When we said we would go home and think about proceeding they say ok but then when we call back the next day they say once you walk out the doors there is no canceling. Lastly if you don’t pay the balance or try to cancel they send you to collections within the 1st few months. So now 4,000.00 down the drain. No jobs booked and no pictures. Not that we even want the pictures and “portfolio” at this time. Just don’t want anyone making the same mistake we did. Please save your money and time. Wish we saw these reviews before it happened to us.

text.text: WARNING. do NOT go to this studio. They waste your time and day to scam you into signing a 4,000.00 contract without explaining properly. Wish we saw these reviews before it happened to us.

originalText.text:
(Personal photos attached, not taken by apex)

Thought I could maybe shine some light over the negative comments here…
I was called by one of the agents named Mel who I have to say is amazing , she explained everything to me and went through and answered every question I had, she was very straightforward of what I should be expecting as far as future payments if I was accepted. She was very uplifting which especially helps when you’re super nervous. I then agreed and paid without thinking or researching and within the few minutes after the call ended I decided I wouldn’t move forward after seeing reviews here and being realistic that financially I wouldn’t be able to afford it.
Again spoke with Mel she was very understanding and patient after hearing about my cancellation. In no way did I feel pressured or even if it was all about money. She even mentioned that she’d be happy to hold my application for 30days after I cancelled if I ever decided to change my mind within that timeframe, which again is very kind of her!
After our conversation I was told to wait for a cancellation message and soon after I will receive my refund.
A little unfortunate the amount of negative reviews here because it really can turn people away.

originalText.text:
Not at all what I expected

Going to the studio was amazing and they really pump you up to make you feel so great. I really liked it but felt pretty stupid and definitely felt like I was taken advantage of now.
Afterwards, They talk and say they want to help and “apply” to places on your behalf but it was not nearly worth the $4000 I put on three separate credit cards in hopes of actually having booked something. It’s funny because the lady who said my pictures “were really great” was rushing to get me through and made it sound like they had their own websites that they use to market and get you jobs, nope they are all ones you have to pay for (like backstage and Allcasting) without going to them and having this ridiculous charge. Also being mentioned of hopes I could book a job within three months of me signing up…this was all wordplay. They know what they’re doing. I have a mediocre at best website, my cards were wrong and I didn’t realize until after sending to places, and the first person that was a mentor sounded like a scripted person. I’m happy some people found this place helpful but this was not my experience. Not even close, they’re pretty much done with you after they give you the little materials and website and little bit of advice. I was really excited to change careers but instead I’m still paying for this mistake, PLEASE THINK TWICE AND DONT LET THEM TALK YOU INTO TOO QUICK, they will never give your money back and you earned that money. This is nothing but a scam, I know first hand

originalText.text: This company is a Biggggg Scam . All the good reviews you see are written by them . They are scam, unprofessional and bad. They force you into paying for something you don’t want . Y’all I paid $3000 for terrible pictures. My phone can take better pictures. Bad agency . Don’t even try to go there . They are worse . Never go there!!!!!!
